thread.title: Tow truck driver badly injured while helping motorist on Deerfoot Trail
thread.title_full: Tow truck driver badly injured while helping motorist on Deerfoot Trail

author: cbc
title: Tow truck driver badly injured while helping motorist on Deerfoot Trail
text:
A tow truck driver in his 50s is in serious but stable condition after being hit by a vehicle on Deerfoot Trail, according to Calgary EMS officials.
It happened around 11:40 a.m. Friday in the northbound lanes near the Peigan Trail turn off.
The man was trying to hook up a vehicle when he was struck by a car, according to EMS spokesperson Stuart Brideaux.
He suffered chest and leg injuries.
Calgary police are investigating.
EMS reminds motorists to slow down and give emergency responders room to work.
Drivers are also urged to use an alternate route as traffic is backed up the area.
Update: NB Deerfoot Tr. between Peigran Tr. & Glenmore Tr. major traffic delays. Use alt route. #ABRoads #yyctraffic https://t.co/AEdmnVV1N4
